instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No keyboard/trackpad
threads.message:
Had a board that did not turn on. I had 5v on pp5v but no volts on pp5v en. So I applied same trick on this rossman video: [URL]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IVgKJF_dIy0[/URL]
I reset pram, and now the board turns on with no issue. while turning on it asks for filevault password the keyboard and trackpad work. when its all booted, it can't find keyboard and trackpad. any ideas?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No keyboard/trackpad
[SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No keyboard/trackpad
threads.message: I'll replace it duke but why would it work in during bootup and not afterwards.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No keyboard/trackpad
threads.message: In boot menu the trackpad works as USB device, in OSX it is a SPI device. Usually it is the cable.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No keyboard/trackpad
threads.message: thanks duke  was the cable.  now i know for next time :)
